square.translation[0].definitions[0].def: having four straight equal sides and 90° angles at the corners
square.translation[0].definitions[1].def: forming a 90° angle, or being close to or similar to a 90° angle
square.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I don’t think the shelf is square with the floor.
square.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if someone’s body or a part of their body is square, it looks broad and strong
square.translation[0].definitions[4].def: someone who is square is boring and old-fashioned
square.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a shape with four straight equal sides with 90° angles at the corners
square.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: First of all, draw a square.
square.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a large open area in the centre of a town or city, usually in the shape of a square, or the buildings surrounding it
square.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The hotel is just off the main square of Sorrento.
square.translation[1].definitions[2].def: the result of multiplying a number by itself
square.translation[1].definitions[3].def: a space on a board used for playing a game such as chess
square.translation[1].definitions[4].def: someone who is considered boring and unfashionable
square.translation[1].definitions[5].def: a flat object with a straight edge, often shaped like an L, used for drawing or measuring 90° angles
square.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to multiply a number by itself
square.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to win a point or game so that you have now won the same number of points or games as the other team or player
square.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: India won the second match to square the series at one each.
square.translation[2].definitions[2].def: to make something straight or parallel
square.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Look him square in the eye and say no.
square.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: Wright passed the ball square to Brown.
square.translation[4].definitions[0].def: an area of measurement equal to a square with sides a metre long, a mile long etc
square.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: The new site will provide 10 million square feet of office space.
square.translation[4].definitions[1].def: shaped like a square with sides that are 5 feet, 2 metres etc long
square.translation[4].definitions[1].exa: The room is six metres square.
square.translation[4].definitions[2].def: if two people are square, they do not owe each other any money
square.translation[4].definitions[2].exa: Here’s your £10 back — that makes us all square.
square.translation[5].definitions[0].def: to pay money to someone in an official position, so that they do what you want
square.translation[5].definitions[0].exa: We’ll have to square a few government officials, if we’re going to get this scheme approved.
